properties.name: Medinfo 2010 - 13th International Congress on Medical Informatics
properties.description: When: Sun Sep 12, 2010 to Wed Sep 15, 2010 Where: Cape Town, South Africa Event Status: confirmed Event Description: This will be the first time MEDINFO is held in Africa. It promises to boost exposure to grassroots healthcare delivery and the underpinning health information systems. This will open the door to new academic partnerships into the future and help to nurture a new breed of health informaticians. http://www.medinfo2010.org/homeMore info

properties.name: BIOSTEC/HealthInf 2010
properties.description: When: Wed Jan 20, 2010 to Sat Jan 23, 2010 Where: Valencia, Spain Event Status: confirmed Event Description: http://www.biostec.org/ The purpose of the 3rd International Conference on Health Informatics is to bring together researchers and practitioners interested in the application of information and communication technologies (ICT) to healthcare and medicine in general and to the specialized support to persons with special needs in particular. Databases, networking, graphical interfaces, intelligent decision support systems and specialized programming languages are just a few of the technologies currently used in medical informatics. Mobility and ubiquity in healthcare systems, standardization of technologies and procedures, certification, privacy are some of the issues that medical informatics professionals and the ICT industry in general need to address in order to further promote ICT in healthcare. In the case of medical rehabilitation and assistive technology the use of ICT has had important results in the enhancement of the quality of life, contributing to a full integration of all citizens in the societies they are also part of. HEALTHINF is a forum for debating all these aspects. Furthermore, this conference is also a meeting place for those interested in understanding the human and social implications of technology, not only in healthcare systems but in other aspects of human-machine interaction such as accessibility issues. HEALTHINF encourages authors to submit papers to one of the main topics indicated below, describing original work, including methods, techniques, advanced prototypes, applications, systems, tools or survey papers, reporting research results and/or indicating future directions. Accepted papers will be presented at the conference by one of the authors and published in the proceedings. Acceptance will be based on quality, relevance and originality. There will be both oral and poster sessions. The proceedings will be indexed by several major international indexers. Special sessions are also welcome. Please contact the secretariat for further information on how to propose a special session. Additional information can be found at http://www.healthinf.org. CONFERENCE TOPICS - e-Health - Telemedicine - Medical and Nursing Informatics - Design and development methodologies for Healthcare IT - Interoperability - Semantic Interoperability - Confidentiality and Data Security - Knowledge management - Databases and Datawarehousing - Datamining - Support for clinical decision-making - Expert Systems in Healthcare - Wearable Health Informatics - Mobile technologies for Healthcare applications - Evaluation and use of Healthcare IT - Physiological Modeling - Cognitive Informatics - Affective Computing - Therapeutic Systems and Technologies - e-Commerce in Health Sector - Healthcare Management Systems - Human-Machine Interfaces for Disabled Persons - Development of Assistive Technology systems for Independent Living - Cognitive rehabilitation - ICT, Ageing and Disability - Practice based Research Methods for Healthcare IT http://www.healthinf.org/cfp.htmMore info

The total theme of this conference is "Health Information is the Global Resource - Sustainable Step in Security, Service, and Symphony". properties.name: eGeH’09; e-government &amp; e-health - 6th International Conference and Exhibition
properties.description: When: Thu Jul 9, 2009 to Sat Jul 11, 2009 Where: Desio/Milan, Italy Event Status: confirmed Event Description: 6th International Conference and Exhibition on e-Government and e-Health - eGeH'09, Desio/Milan, Italy Topics include: * Administrative Information Systems * Electronic Documents and Protocols * Medical Inforamtion Systems * Telemedicine (Radiology, Cardiology, Opthalmology, etc.) * Digital Signature, Electronic Identity Cards, Telehomecare/P-Health, Biomedical Devices * Biometrics, Cryptography and Security, Internet in Health Care * Smart Cards in P.A. and Health Services http://www.aitim.it/More info

properties.description: When: Sat Oct 10, 2009 to Mon Oct 12, 2009 Where: Hotel Dieu de France Hospital, Beirut, Lebanon Event Status: confirmedMore info

properties.name: European Ambient Assisted Living Forum 2009
properties.description: When: Tue Sep 29, 2009 to Thu Oct 1, 2009 Where: Hofburg, Vienna, Austria Event Status: confirmed Event Description: The AAL FORUM 09 is the kick-off event of the international conference series of the AAL-JP and will serve as an information and discussion platform for stakeholders, scientists and users in Europe. The AAL Joint Programme (AAL JP) is a new joint research and development (R&D) funding activity implemented by actual 20 European Member States and 3 Associated States with the financial support of the European Community based on article 169 of the EC treaty. The overall objective of the programme is to enhance the quality of life of older people and strengthen the industrial base in Europe through the use of Information and Communication Technologies (ICT). For further information and registration, please visit: http://www.bmvit.gv.at/aalMore info

properties.name: HealthGrid 2009 Berlin
properties.description: When: Mon Jun 29, 2009 to Wed Jul 1, 2009 Where: Berlin Event Status: confirmed Event Description: The HealthGrid conference is the premier conference on the transformation of biomedical research, education and medical care through the application of Grid technologies. HealthGrid is dedicated to: * Enhancing biomedical research and healthcare delivery * Creating an open collaborative virtual community * Communicating the collective knowledge of the HealthGrid community HealthGrid is an interdisciplinary community of computer scientists, physicians, medical educators and students, epidemiologists, bioinformatics and medical informatics experts, military medicine specialists, security and policy makers, economists and futurists. http://berlin2009.healthgrid.org/More info

properties.name: Patient Experience Summit: Transforming Healthcare through Empathy and Innovation
properties.description: When: Tue Nov 3, 2009 to Wed Nov 4, 2009 Where: Cleveland, OH Event Status: confirmed Event Description: Patient experience has emerged as a dynamic issue for healthcare CEOs, physicians, and industry leaders. No provider can afford to offer patients and families anything less than the best clinical, physical, and emotional experience. Right now, patient experience is emerging as a key differentiator. A measure of quality. An absolute necessity in good times and bad. Patients want it, need it and deserve it. Now we need to begin a global discussion of patient experience and what it means to the future of healthcare. Please join us November 3-4, 2009 for the Patient Experience Summit: Transforming Healthcare through Empathy and Innovation. This historic summit will gather global thought leaders to solve our shared challenges and inspire innovative solutions that will transform our industry. You will meet and hear healthcare CEOs, philanthropists, global executives, policy makers, patients and caregivers. You will hear presentations, debate, and frank discussion of key issues of patient experience. Together, we will begin an ongoing collaboration and idea exchange that will reinvent the delivery of healthcare, and benefit patients everywhere. Be there. Take action. Transform the patient experience. Toby Cosgrove, MD and Bridget Duffy, MD Cleveland Clinic http://www.clevelandclinic.org/collective/index.htmlMore info

properties.name: TeleMed &amp; eHealth '09
properties.description: When: Mon Nov 23, 2009 to Tue Nov 24, 2009 Who: Health Informatics Events Where: London Event Status: confirmed Event Description: Telemedicine continues to evolve both clinical and tele-health applications to improve patient healthcare. There is an increasing global focus of empowering patients themselves in their own medical management. Telemed 09 aims to put the patient at the centre of the delivery of medical treatment in a series of academic and clinical presentations. http://www.rsm.ac.uk/telemed09/More info

properties.name: mHealth Initiative 1st Annual Conference and Exhibits
properties.description: When: Wed Dec 9, 2009 to Thu Dec 10, 2009 Where: Copley Marriot Hotel, Boston MA Event Status: confirmed Event Description: mHealth Initiative Inc. aims to provide the healthcare community with information and resources about new and emerging cell phone, PDA, and other mobile technologies for use in healthcare. The mHealth Initiative Community is an Internet-based community for healthcare professionals and developers. In its open section, all healthcare stakeholders will be able to research resources of vendors and applications as well as exchange experiences on implementing mHealth applications. The Member Section will facilitate professional and technical exchanges. Convinced that mobile device (mDevice) applications will have an international market, mHealth Initiative is planning both national and international workshops and seminars to explore the field. Its conferences and events will focus on the new developments and current trends in mDevice technologies as they relate to healthcare. http://www.mhealthinitiative.org/Meetings.phpMore info

properties.name: NHS Data Sharing and Information Governance
properties.description: When: Thu Jul 16, 2009Where: NHS Data Sharing and Information Governance Event Status: confirmed Event Description: Complementing our well established conferences, our new interactive seminars focus on what supports delivery. Set within the context of Government priorities and legislation, we will help you understand organisational structures, how to make the most of your workforce and how to build successful partnerships across the public and third sector. http://www.capitaconferences.co.uk/NR/rdonlyres/A96C6885-7E46-4475-AFDB-FE3FA29CF713/0/NHSdataSharingEMMK.pdfMore info

properties.name: AHI'10 - Applied Health Informatics Conference 2010
properties.description: When: Wed Apr 28, 2010Where: Health Sciences Campus, University of Waterloo, Kitchener, Ontario, Canada Event Status: confirmed Event Description: http://www.nihi.ca/ahi2010 AHI is a top-tier, peer-reviewed, academic Health Informatics conference addressing both research and education and will attract academics, visionaries and experts from around the globe. The first national academic Health Informatics conference (AHI’10) will be held April 28 - 30, 2010 at the University of Waterloo's new Health Sciences Campus at the School of Pharmacy in Kitchener, Ontario. This conference will have three primary themes: 1. progress in health informatics research 2. advances in health informatics education 3. new developments in evidence-based e-health policy development and implementation This inaugural conference will be co-hosted by the National Institutes of Health Informatics (NIHI) and the Waterloo Institute for Health Informatics Research (WIHIR).More info

properties.name: National Telecare and Telehealth Conference
properties.description: When: Mon Nov 16, 2009 to Wed Nov 18, 2009 Where: London, UK Event Status: confirmed Event Description: Featuring nationally, and internationally acclaimed speakers in the areas of telecare, telehealth and the ageing population, delegates will find the conference full of stimulating discussion and debate. Main conference speakers include Dame Joan Bakewell, acclaimed writer and broadcaster, and now the nationally recognised champion of age equality issues, and Janice E Knoefel, MD, MPH, Professor of Medicine (Gerontology) and Neurology, University of New Mexico, expert on the management of chronic conditions using telehealth. http://www.telecare.org.uk/information/47914/conference_09/More info

properties.name: Health 2.0 Paris
properties.description: When: Tue Apr 6, 2010 to Wed Apr 7, 2010 Where: Paris Event Status: confirmed Event Description: Health 2.0 is fundamentally about creating appropriate consumer and professional content using search, communities and tools, and using those tools to enhance the patient-physician relationship. The phenomenon has exploded in importance in the USA in the last three years, and we’ve had many requests to discuss and demonstrate Health 2.0 in Europe. The time is right! So we’re coming to Paris, April 6 & 7, 2010. http://www.health2con.com/paris2010/More info

properties.name: Global Health &amp; Innovation Summit
properties.description: When: Sat Apr 17, 2010 to Sun Apr 18, 2010 Where: Yale University, New Haven, Connecticut, USA Event Status: confirmed Event Description: The World's Leading Idea Incubator For Global Health Innovation A Conference Presented Annually by Unite For Sight Saturday, April 17 - Sunday, April 18, 2010 Yale University, New Haven, Connecticut, USA Registration Open and Call For Abstracts As Featured On The Summit is what CNN calls "A Meeting of Minds" High-Impact Creativity and Best Practice Health Innovation In Action * 200 Speakers representing all disciplines of global health, social entrepreneurship, international development, and innovation. Keynote speakers includeSeth Godin, Jeffrey Sachs and Sonia Sachs. * Social innovation sessions by CEOs and Directors of Acumen Fund, Partners in Health, WaterPartners, Save The Children, HealthStore Foundation, and many others. * Opportunities abound to engage with leading innovators and ground-breaking ideas for change. * 2,200 Participants from all 50 states and from more than 55 countries who are interested in global health and international development, public health, eye care, medicine, social entrepreneurship, nonprofits, philanthropy, microfinance, human rights, anthropology, health policy, advocacy, public service, environmental health, and education. * Collaborate on tools to identify global problems, engage in social entreperneurship, and create change and real solutions. * Network with individuals, organizations, universities, the public, and communities. http://www.uniteforsight.org/conferenceMore info

properties.name: Integrating EHR &amp; eClinical Technologies Conference
properties.description: When: Mon Sep 14, 2009 to Tue Sep 15, 2009 Where: Hilton Washington Embassy Row Event Status: confirmed Event Description: The new administration's American Recovery and Reinvestment Act authorizes a $19 billion investment in health technology aiming to strengthen and modernize our health care system through the adoption of health IT solutions. It is crucial for the drug industry to capitalize on the opportunity this stimulus package offers by transforming eClinical Technologies in tandem with healthcare IT to achieve eventual convergence and maximum patient safety. Feedback from prior Integrating EHR & eClinical Technologies Conferences: “The convergence and application of health data is potentially the biggest break through in the pharmaceutical industry over the last 25 years. This conference was pivotal in exploring not only what’s available in health data, but how to leverage it into value through shorter development timelines and significantly reduced development costs. A great conference for Health IT, Clinical Development, and Product Marketing professionals.” - Marty Frazier, eCast Corp “The ExL Pharma event brought together experts from academia, pharma and other HIT-focused industry players. The focused, intimate setting of the conference allowed productive and in-depth interactions amongst the various participants.” – Chandu Ammini, Perlegen “Undoubtedly one of the best conferences I have ever attended” – Somesh Nigam, Johnson & Johnson “Thank you for pioneering this subject matter. Most interactive meeting I have ever been to” Hugh Donovan, Accenture “This was the best conference I have been to that showed the value of integrative information from EHRs into clinical trials” – Jerry Schindler, Merck http://www.exlpharma.com/eventDetail.php?id=202More info

properties.name: Mobile Technologies as a Platform for Health Research and Delivery
properties.description: When: Thu Oct 29, 2009 to Fri Oct 30, 2009 Where: washington DC ronald reagan building Event Status: confirmed Event Description: Mobile technologies hold promise for playing a crucial, strategic role in reducing health disparities around the world, but there is limited research that gauges their current efficacy and which could accelerate their successful use. To that end, the Foundation for the National Institutes of Health will convene, along with the NIH, other government agencies and leading international organizations and foundations, the mHealth Summit. The mHealth Summit: A public-private partnership of the Foundation for NIH, is an unprecedented event that will bring together researchers, policy-makers, collaborators and visionaries from around the world to exchange ideas, novel approaches, research and findings surrounding mHealth issues both in the United States and in developing countries. http://guest.cvent.com/EVENTS/Info/Summary.aspx?e=b5cf7bfc-b867-4877-911b-ceb61c994166More info

properties.name: ANIA-CARING conference

The theme will be “Re-Evolution in Nursing Informatics”, reflecting the ever-increasing role and importance of information technology in the nursing profession and practice.More info

properties.name: Joining for Visions of Person Centred Health
properties.description: When: Wed Oct 21, 2009 to Thu Oct 22, 2009 Where: Brussels, Belgium Event Status: confirmed Event Description: EHTEL kindly invites all members, friends, collegues and eHealth enthusiasts in Europe to the symposium "Joining for Visons of Person-centric Health", held on 21-22 October 2009 in the premises of the European Economic and Social Committee (EESC), Rue Belliard 99, 1000 Brussels, Belgium. http://www.ehtel.org/forum/announcements/10-anniversary-symposiumMore info

properties.name: 5th Annual Canadian Health Informatics Awards Gala
properties.description: When: Thu Nov 19, 2009Where: Toronto, ON, Canada Event Status: confirmed Event Description: The 5th annual CANADIAN HEALTH INFORMATICS AWARDS (CHIA) GALA , proudly co-hosted by ITAC Health, the Information Technology Association of Canada, and COACH, Canada's Health Informatics Association, will be staged this year at the Four Seasons Hotel in Toronto on Thursday, November 19, 2009. Celebrating the outstanding achievements and excellence in the Canadian Health Informatics industry, the CHIA Gala recognizes and honours the contributions of individuals and companies in the efficient use of information technology to improve the health of all Canadians. This elegant evening will feature a cocktail reception followed by a sumptuous four course dinner with wine and the presentation of awards. The CHIA Gala rolls out the red carpet and puts the celebrated nominees, winners and other industry achievers "In The Spotlight". The CHIA Gala, one of Canada's leading eHealth industry events honours leaders and innovators in the following categories: Leadership in the Field of Health Informatics, Innovation in the Adoption of Health Informatics, Emerging Leader in Health Informatics, Community-Based Physician Leader/Innovator and Steven Huesing Scholarship, are presented by COACH. "The awards provide our industry with an ideal opportunity to pay tribute to the imagination, resourcefulness and leadership that is so important in health informatics," says COACH President Linda Miller. "With the rapid pace of change in our field, it is more important than ever to recognize outstanding efforts by our colleagues. COACH calls on HI professionals across the country to nominate deserving colleagues and projects from their organization, health authority, community and province or territory." ITAC Health presents awards to: Company of the Year, Corporate Citizenship: Multi-National Company and Small to Medium Enterprise, Healthcare Transformation and Project Implementation Team of the Year. "I believe it is important that we stand back for one evening and recognize accomplishments in our industry, and those that have made them happen." explained Dave Wattling, the Chair of the ITAC Health Board. "I hope everyone will be able to join us, again, for this 'must attend' event of the year. You will not be disappointed!" The 2009 CHIA Gala promises to be a sold out, Black Tie affair that offers a selection of tiered opportunities which maximize exposure to the eHealth industry for sponsors of this prestigious event. Sponsorship Opportunities, guarantee your Return on Investment. Demonstrate your support through sponsorship, advertising and attending the CHIA Gala. This gala will be widely promoted across Canada and is a significant opportunity to gain valuable exposure with our high-profile attendees and the eHealth industry. Information on ticket purchases, advertising in the program book and sponsorship is available. For further information contact Jones & Jones Productions Ltd. at 905.452.1911 or at info@healthinformaticsawards.ca. http://www.healthinformaticsawards.ca/More info
